core.parsing

Class InputParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.parsing.InputParser

  • public class InputParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses text input and returns a set of equations, functions, and a goal

      InputParser()

      • parseSystem

        public static EquationSystem parseSystem(java.util.List<java.lang.String> input)
                                  throws ParserException
        Throws:
        ParserException

      • parseFunction

        public static Function parseFunction(java.lang.String line,
                                     java.util.Set<Function> Sigma,
                                     java.util.Set<Function> C)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Takes a string as input and constructs a Function object from this input
        Parameters:
        line - the input string
        Sigma - A set of functions that have been parsed already, the parsed function will be added
        C - A set of functions (constructors) that have been parsed already, the parsed function will be added if line begins with **
        Returns:
        A Function object based on the contents of the input string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameters are null, or line is incorrectly structured
        See Also:
        Function

      • parseEquation

        public static Equation parseEquation(java.util.Set<Function> functions,
                                     java.lang.String line)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                     InvalidFunctionArgumentException,
                                     NoSortException
        Takes a string and a set of functions as input and constructs an Equation object from this input
        Parameters:
        functions - A set of functions that are necessary to recognize function symbols in the input string
        line - The input string
        Returns:
        An Equation object based on the contents of the input string and functions
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if functions is empty or null, line is null, line contains less or more than one "=", or line is empty left or right of "="
        InvalidFunctionArgumentException - if parsing the left or right term throws an InvalidFunctionArgumentException
        NoSortException - if the sort of left AND right cannot be deduced
        See Also:
        Equation, Function

      • parseTerm

        public static Term parseTerm(java.util.Set<Function> functions,
                             java.lang.String line,
                             Sort varSort)
                      throws InvalidFunctionArgumentException,
                             NoSortException
        Takes a string and a set of functions as input and constructs a Term object from this input
        Parameters:
        functions - A set of functions that are necessary to recognize function symbols in the input string
        line - The input string
        varSort - The expected sort of the variable if line represents a variable
        Returns:
        A term object that represents the same term as line
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if functions is null, line is null or empty, or has an invalid format which cannot be parsed
        InvalidFunctionArgumentException - if the arguments of a function are invalid
        NoSortException - if a sort should be specified to parse this term (for example if it's a variable, or there are two functions with equal names but different sorts) but varSort is null
        See Also:
        Function, Term, Variable, FunctionTerm
